info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:16PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN TRANSYLVANIA...NORTHWESTERN HENDERSON...EAST CENTRAL HAYWOOD AND SOUTHWESTERN BUNCOMBE COUNTIES UNTIL 645 PM EDT... At 616 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rainfall 11 miles north of Brevard, or near Mount Pisgah. This storm was nearly stationary. Locations to be impacted include... Mills River, Bent Creek, B.R. Parkway-Mount Pisgah To The Nc Arboretum, Mount Pisgah, Enka, Mountain Home, Etowah, Looking Glass, Candler and Horse Shoe. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
